1.speaker: sasako
1.english: Thank you for all of your hard work.

3.speaker: polar bear
3.japanese: 明日は　休日だから楽しんできてね
3.english: Tomorrow's your day off, so enjoy it.

5.speaker: sasako
5.japanese: このところ毎日冷えますね

7.speaker: sasako
7.japanese: 帰ったら　ゆっくりお風呂入って 疲れ取ろうっと
7.english: When I get home, I'm going to take a nice, hot bath and relax.

9.speaker: sasako
9.japanese: それじゃ　おやすみなさい

11.speaker: polar bear
11.japanese: 僕も　お風呂は大好きなんだ
11.english: I love baths, too. Ice baths are the best!

12.speaker: polar bear
12.english: This may be a little cramped.

13.speaker: polar bear
13.japanese: 本当は　プカプカ　ユラユラしたいのに
13.english: I'd like to have more room.

15.speaker: penguin
15.japanese: おっと　さっきのそばに入ってたにしんは　何匹だった
15.english: Hey. How many sardines were in that soba?

16.speaker: penguin
16.japanese: へえ　ニシンが８匹で９　１０　１１…
16.english: Yes... There were eight sardines and... Nine, ten, eleven...

17.speaker: panda
17.japanese: どうしたの　ペンギンさん

19.speaker: panda
19.japanese: なにブツブツ１人でしゃべってるの
19.english: Why are you mumbling to yourself?

21.speaker: penguin
21.japanese: パンダ君と一緒にしないで

22.speaker: penguin
22.japanese: 今　僕がやってたのは『にしんそば』っていう落語でね
22.english: I was just performing a story called "Sardine Soba."

23.speaker: panda
23.japanese: 歩きながら食べちゃダメって お母さんに怒られない
23.english: Won't your mom get mad at you for eating and walking at the same time?

24.speaker: penguin
24.japanese: 食べてないよ これは落語でね
24.english: I'm not eating! This is comedic story-telling...

25.speaker: panda
25.japanese: ペンギンさん目をつぶって歩いていると 人のお家に入っちゃうよ
25.english: Mr. Penguin. If you walk around with your eyes closed, you might end up in someone else's house.

27.japanese: だいたい　ちゃんとパッチリ開いてるから
27.english: Not to mention my eyes are wide open.

28.speaker: panda
28.english: What? I can't see them at all.

29.speaker: penguin
29.japanese: そっちだってよくわかんないでしょ
29.english: Well, we can't really see your eyes, either.

30.speaker: panda
30.japanese: つぶらな瞳って言ってよ

31.speaker: penguin
31.japanese: というか　パンダ君がなんでここにいるの
31.english: Or rather, what are you doing here?

33.speaker: panda
33.japanese: ペンギンさん　僕んちに何か用
33.english: Did you need something, Mr. Penguin?

37.japanese: さっきの話だけど　僕ね
37.english: Continuing what we were talking about earlier, but I'm thinking about doing some comedic storytelling at a party.

38.speaker: panda
38.japanese: パーティーも寒くなりそうだね
38.english: It might get cold at the party, too.

39.speaker: penguin
39.japanese: キミにしては珍しいウイットはいらないから
39.english: We don't need the rare witty comment from you.

40.speaker: penguin
40.japanese: だいたい　なんで寒くなるって決めつけるの
40.english: Not to mention, how do you know it'll be dull?

41.speaker: penguin
41.japanese: バカウケするとか考えないわけ
41.english: You don't think it might actually be super funny?

43.speaker: penguin
43.japanese: そんなこと言うのはパンダ君だけだよ
43.english: You're the only one that thinks that.

44.speaker: panda
44.japanese: じゃあ　誰かに聞いてもらう
44.english: Then do you want to have someone listen to it?

46.speaker: penguin
46.japanese: じゃあ　パンダ君　聞いてよ
46.english: Okay, then listen to this, Panda.

47.speaker: penguin
47.japanese: え　では毎度ばかばかしい小話を１つ…
47.english: Well, let's start off with another slightly idiotic tale...

52.speaker: penguin
52.japanese: シロクマ君　すぐ休んじゃうんだね
52.english: Polar Bear doesn't hesitate to close up, does he?

53.speaker: penguin
53.english: You want Polar Bear to listen?

54.speaker: panda
54.japanese: うん　ペンギンさんのつまんない落語を聞いてもらおうと思って
54.english: Yeah. I thought we'd have him listen to your boring stories.

55.speaker: penguin
55.japanese: つまんなくないよ　大爆笑だよあ…

56.speaker: penguin
56.english: Huh? I wonder what Polar Bear's doing in the yard.

57.speaker: penguin
57.japanese: 大きな布　持ってるね

58.speaker: panda
58.japanese: 家出　止めなくちゃ
58.english: Maybe he's running away? We've got to stop him!

59.speaker: penguin
59.japanese: パンダ君じゃないんだから

61.speaker: penguin
61.japanese: 自分の家で何を盗むの
61.english: What's he going to steal from his own place?

62.speaker: panda
62.japanese: そうか　わかったよ きっと　サンタさんだ
62.english: Oh, I know! He must be Santa!

63.speaker: panda
63.japanese: かついでるのはプレゼントの入った袋だよ
63.english: What he's holding is his bag of presents!

64.speaker: penguin
64.japanese: クリスマスは　とっくに過ぎたでしょ
64.english: Christmas came and went a long time ago!

65.speaker: panda
65.japanese: きっと僕へのプレゼントが入ってるよ
65.english: There must be a present for me in there! Hey, wait! Panda?!

67.speaker: polar bear
67.japanese: うん この木とこの木の距離がちょうどよさそう
67.english: Yes. The distance between these trees is about perfect. I wonder what's in here. Hey, it's empty.

68.speaker: polar bear
68.japanese: あれ　パンダ君　ペンギンさん
68.english: Oh, Panda and Mr. Penguin. Hey.

71.speaker: panda
71.japanese: うん　これ　プレゼントの袋でしょ
71.english: Yeah! This is a bag of presents, right?

72.speaker: polar bear
72.japanese: ああ　これはね 癒やしグッズなんだよ

75.speaker: polar bear
75.japanese: 木にクッションをあててロープを結ぶっと　そして…
75.english: I'm going to put a cushion on the tree and then tie this end. And then...

76.speaker: panda
76.japanese: あっ　ハンモックだ

78.speaker: panda
78.japanese: ねぇ　シロクマ君　乗ってみていい
78.english: Hey, Polar Bear, could I get in?

81.speaker: polar bear
81.japanese: ペンギンさんも　どうぞ
81.english: You can get in, too, Mr. Penguin.

83.speaker: panda
83.japanese: ペンギンさん　よかったら先に…
83.english: Mr. Penguin, if you want, you can go ahead...

85.speaker: panda
85.japanese: 僕が乗ると こそこで見てていいよ

86.speaker: penguin
86.japanese: なに　その新しい譲り方

87.speaker: polar bear
87.japanese: 大きいから一緒に乗れるよ
87.english: It's big, so we can in together.

91.speaker: polar bear
91.japanese: ああ　あんまり大きく揺らすと…
91.english: Oh, if it sways too much...

94.speaker: polar bear
94.japanese: ハンモックの寝方はね　こう
94.english: The way you lay in a hammock is... Like this.

95.speaker: polar bear
95.japanese: まず　中央にそっと座って そのまま後ろにゴロンとする
95.english: First, you sit in the center carefully, and then roll back.

96.speaker: polar bear
96.japanese: 横か斜めに寝ると 落ちにくいし 快適だよ
96.english: If you lay sideways or at an angle, it's harder to slip out and is ideal.

98.speaker: penguin
98.japanese: 落ちる前に言ってほしかったよ
98.english: It would've been nice if you had told us that earlier.

101.speaker: penguin
101.japanese: こういう場所で飲むコーヒーもいいね
101.english: Having coffee like this isn't bad at all.

106.speaker: panda
106.japanese: ペンギンさん　そういえば僕たち　何しにきたんだっけ
106.english: By the way, Mr. Penguin, why did we come here again? Why {\i1}did{\i0} you come here?

108.japanese: 今度　僕がパーティーでやる予定の落語をね
108.english: I'm practicing my comedic storytelling for the next party and...

109.speaker: panda
109.japanese: たしか　どうでもいいことだよ
109.english: I think it wasn't anything important. What?!

110.speaker: polar bear
110.japanese: そうか どうでもいいことなんだね
110.english: I see. So, it wasn't important.

111.speaker: penguin
111.japanese: あっ　どうでもよくないよ

112.speaker: polar bear
112.japanese: このユラユラ海に浮かんでいるみたい
112.english: The way the hammock is swaying, I feel like I'm floating in the ocean.

113.speaker: polar bear
113.japanese: 北極の海を泳ぎ回っていた頃を思い出すな
113.english: It reminds me of when I was swimming around in the arctic ocean.

114.speaker: polar bear
114.japanese: 今度から　ここで北極気分を味わおうっと
114.english: Now I'll enjoy that feeling from here.

116.speaker: sasako
116.english: It snowed quite a bit today.

117.speaker: sasako
117.japanese: に　庭に何か巨大なものが
117.english: S-Something very large is in the yard!

118.speaker: polar bear
118.japanese: あぁ　笹子さん　おはよう

120.speaker: polar bear
120.japanese: 今朝は快適な冷え具合だね

122.speaker: sasako
122.japanese: シロクマさん　さすが北極仕様ですね
122.english: Mr. Polar Bear... Nothing less from someone from the Arctic...

123.speaker: everyone
123.japanese: パンダママのガーデニング

124.speaker: polar bear
124.japanese: あっ　グリズリー君　シロクマだけど

126.speaker: polar bear
126.japanese: グリズリー君　鏡餅
126.english: Grizzly, should I grill the New Year's rice cakes or make them into ozouni soup?

127.speaker: grizzly
127.japanese: なんで俺に聞くんだよ

128.speaker: grizzly
128.japanese: 俺は冬眠中だって言ってんだろ
128.english: I told you, I'm hibernating, damn it!

129.speaker: polar bear
129.japanese: どっちがいいか悩んでて 最近　眠れないんだけど
129.english: I can't decide between the two and I've been losing sleep over this.

130.speaker: polar bear
130.japanese: どうすればいいと思う
130.english: What do you think I should do?

131.speaker: grizzly
131.japanese: いいから俺を眠らせろ
131.english: Shut up and let me sleep!

132.speaker: panda mama
132.japanese: 起きなさい　もうお昼よ

133.speaker: panda
133.japanese: もうちょっと寝かせてよ
133.english: Let me sleep just a little longer...

134.speaker: panda mama
134.japanese: いいかげんにしなさい

135.speaker: panda mama
135.japanese: あなた　いったい一日どれだけ寝れば気が済むの
135.english: How long do you have to sleep to be satisfied?

137.speaker: panda mama
137.japanese: まったく　そんなにいつも寝てばっかりで
137.english: Goodness. You do nothing but sleep.

139.speaker: panda
139.japanese: お母さん　クマとかは冬眠じゃなくて冬ごもりって言うんだよ
139.english: Mom, bears don't call it hibernating. They call it staying in for the winter.

142.speaker: panda
142.japanese: パンダは冬ごもりはできないって言われてるけど
142.english: They say that pandas can't stay indoors for the winter,

143.speaker: panda
143.japanese: 僕　頑張って挑戦してみるよ
143.english: but I'll do my best to try!

144.speaker: panda
144.japanese: じゃあ　春になったら起こしてね
144.english: Okay, wake me up in the spring. Don't suck me up!

145.speaker: panda mama
145.japanese: さて　掃除が一段落したらと…
145.english: Well, then... Since I'm done with the cleaning for now...

146.speaker: panda mama
146.japanese: しばし　私の大切な時間
146.english: I'll take a moment to enjoy myself.

148.speaker: panda
148.japanese: また庭を耕してるんだ

149.speaker: panda
149.english: She sure likes that. Oh, my.

150.speaker: panda mama
150.japanese: ガーデニングと呼んでちょうだい

151.speaker: panda mama
151.japanese: 最近は　花や木だけじゃなくて
151.english: Lately, it's not just flowers and trees,

152.speaker: panda mama
152.japanese: 野菜なんかも作ってみたりしてるのよね
152.english: but I've started growing vegetables, too.

153.speaker: panda mama
153.japanese: 野菜って　たくさん収穫できると食費も浮いて嬉しいわね
153.english: It's nice when a lot of vegetables grow because we'll have so much more to eat.

154.speaker: panda mama
154.japanese: はぁ　お花と菜園とで結構　忙しいわ
154.english: The flowers and the vegetable garden keep me rather busy.

155.speaker: panda mama
155.japanese: チュ　チューリップの芽がちぎれてる

157.speaker: panda
157.japanese: あ　それ　チューリップだったの

158.speaker: panda
158.japanese: 僕　ネギだと思って さっき食べちゃった
158.english: I thought they were green onions and I ate them.

160.speaker: panda
160.japanese: どうりでネギの味じゃないと思った
160.english: No wonder they didn't taste like green onions.

161.speaker: panda mama
161.english: The green onions are over there!

163.speaker: panda mama
163.japanese: な　なんてことなの…

164.speaker: panda mama
164.japanese: 春になったら　かわいいお花がつくはずだったのに
164.english: Cute little flowers should have bloomed in the spring.

166.speaker: panda mama
166.japanese: ターシャ・パンダーさんばりのお庭にするはずだったのに…
166.english: And I wanted to make a garden like Ms. Tasha Panda.

167.speaker: panda mama
167.japanese: こんなお庭では　ターシャ・パンダーさんに顔向けできないわ
167.english: With a garden like this, how will I ever face Ms. Tasha Panda?

168.speaker: panda mama
168.japanese: ああ　あの子ったら　バカ　バカ　バカ

169.speaker: penguin
169.japanese: いつ　むー　なな

170.speaker: penguin
170.japanese: おっと　さっきのそばに入ってたにしんは何匹だった
170.english: Hey, how many sardines were in that soba?

173.speaker: penguin
173.english: One... Ack! Hey! Don't butt in at the best part, Polar Bear!

175.speaker: penguin
175.japanese: ったく　ちゃんと聞いてたの

176.speaker: penguin
176.japanese: そういえば　２人とも一度も笑ってないよね
176.english: Come to think of it, neither of you even laughed once, did you?

179.speaker: penguin
179.japanese: 笑いどころわかってないんじゃない
179.english: I don't think you know where you're supposed to laugh.

180.speaker: penguin
180.english: I guess I don't have a choice.

181.speaker: penguin
181.japanese: １０回目だけどもう一度　最初からやるよ
181.english: This is the tenth time, but I'm starting from the top again.

183.speaker: sasako
183.japanese: あっ　パンダ君 いらっしゃい

184.speaker: polar bear
184.japanese: どうしたの　元気ないね
184.english: What's the matter? You seem down.

185.speaker: penguin
185.japanese: うん…じゃあ　元気づけに　僕の落語を聞かせてあげるよ
185.english: How about I cheer you up with one of my comedic stories?

186.speaker: polar bear
186.japanese: 聞かせないほうがいいかもね
186.english: Maybe we should skip that. Why?!

188.speaker: panda
188.japanese: さっきお母さんの植えたチューリップを
188.english: I accidentally ate my mom's tulips because

189.japanese: ネギと間違えて食べちゃったんだよ
189.english: I thought they were green onions.

191.speaker: sasako
191.japanese: それはお母さん　怒ったんじゃない
191.english: I'm guessing that your mom was a little mad about that.

192.speaker: panda
192.japanese: うん　だからここに逃げてきたの
192.english: Yeah... that's why I ran away to here.

193.speaker: penguin
193.japanese: キミ　なんでも食べちゃうんだね

194.speaker: panda
194.japanese: それでね　シロクマ君
194.english: So, I was wondering, Polar Bear...

196.speaker: panda
196.japanese: 代わりのお花 何か分けてくれない
196.english: Could you spare some of your flowers?

197.speaker: polar bear
197.japanese: 食べたのって　どんなチューリップ
197.english: What kind of tulips did you eat? I already ate them, so I have no idea. Oh, I see.

198.speaker: penguin
198.japanese: お母さんが喜びそうな花にしたらいいんじゃない
198.english: How about picking out some flowers that your mom will like?

200.speaker: panda
200.japanese: でも　どんな花ならお母さん　喜ぶのかな
200.english: But I wonder what kind of flowers she'll like.

202.speaker: rinrin
202.japanese: いらっしゃい　パンダ君

203.speaker: rinrin
203.english: What can I get you today?

204.speaker: rinrin
204.japanese: ほら　笹があるよ すっごくおいしいよ
204.english: Look! I've got bamboo grass, too! It's scrumptious!

205.speaker: panda
205.japanese: 別にリンリンに用はないやい
205.english: I don't need anything from you, Rin Rin.

206.speaker: rinrin
206.english: Oh, I see... Don't be like that, Panda.

207.speaker: penguin
207.japanese: 今日は用があって来たんでしょ
207.english: You came here because you need somethig, right?

210.speaker: penguin
210.japanese: だから　どんな花を植えたら

211.japanese: パンダ君のお母さんの機嫌が直るかを知りたくて
211.english: so you could maybe help us pick out some flowers

212.japanese: この店に連れてきたんだよ
212.english: that might cheer his mom up. You garden at home, too, right? So do you know something my mom would like? I might know...

213.japanese: でも　パンダ君のお母さんの機嫌を直すには
213.english: But would it be enough to just plant flowers your mom may like?

214.speaker: penguin
214.japanese: それも　そうだよね

218.speaker: panda
218.japanese: 昨日は　チューリップ食べちゃってごめんなさい
218.english: I'm really sorry for eating your tulips yesterday. Oh.

219.speaker: panda
219.japanese: 別のお花を植えたので許してほしいです
219.english: I planted some other flowers, so please forgive me.

220.speaker: panda mama
220.japanese: わかったわ　見せてちょうだい
220.english: Oh, all right. Show them to me. He should be showing her the flowers right about now.

221.speaker: rinrin
221.japanese: お花　喜んでもらえてればいいんですが…

223.speaker: sasako
223.japanese: 早く結果が知りたいですね
223.english: I'd love to hear the results soon.

224.speaker: penguin
224.japanese: そうだ パンダ君の結果を待ってる間
224.english: Oh, I know. While we're waiting for Panda's results,

225.speaker: penguin
225.japanese: 僕が落語を聞かせてあげようか
225.english: I'll do some of my comedic storytelling.

228.speaker: penguin
228.japanese: じゃ　始めるよ お題は『にしんそば』
228.english: All right, here we go. The title is Sardine Soba.

229.speaker: penguin
229.japanese: ある晩のこと　そば屋が屋台を引いてるってえと
229.english: One night, a soba stand owner was setting up,

230.speaker: penguin
230.japanese: 現れた客が声をかけて
230.english: when a customer called out, "Hey, soba stand owner..."

231.speaker: polar bear
231.japanese: お後が　よろしいようで

232.speaker: penguin
232.english: Hey! I just started, Polar Bear!

233.speaker: penguin
233.japanese: いいや　カフェモカおかわり
233.english: Never mind. Can I get another café mocha?

235.speaker: panda
235.english: Over here. Oh, some wild chrysanthemums and purples pansies?

236.speaker: panda mama
236.japanese: ずいぶん渋い取り合わせね

237.speaker: panda
237.japanese: お母さん　ここに上がって見て

239.speaker: panda mama
239.japanese: わ…　私の顔になってるわ

240.speaker: panda
240.english: I wonder... if she likes them...

241.speaker: panda mama
241.japanese: ターシャ・パンダーさんのようにはならなかったけど…
241.english: It didn't end up like Ms. Tasha Panda's,

242.speaker: panda mama
242.japanese: でも　私らしいすてきなお庭になったわ
242.english: but it's become my very own one-of-a-kind garden.

244.speaker: panda
244.japanese: ペンギンさん　ペンギンさん

245.speaker: penguin
245.english: What is it, Panda? I'll give you one minute, so show me everything you've got.

246.speaker: penguin
246.japanese: それは調整しなくていいかな
246.english: I'd rather not give that a try.

247.speaker: panda
247.japanese: ペンギンさんのすべてって　一分もないんだね
247.english: I guess everything you have doesn't take a whole minute...

248.speaker: penguin
248.japanese: 僕　そういうニュアンスで言ったかな
248.english: Is that what I was hinting at?

249.speaker: sasako
249.japanese: 来週のしろくまカフェは

250.speaker: penguin
250.japanese: 攻め込むね　笹子さん
250.english: Butting right in I see, Miss Sasako...

252.speaker: polar bear
